get.description:
Lists all cloud providers available on Zilliz Cloud. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request GET "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/clouds" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": [ { "cloudId": "ali", "description": "Alibaba Cloud" }, { "cloudId": "tc", "description": "Tencent Cloud" } ] } ```

200.description: Returns a list of all available cloud providers on Zilliz Cloud.

cloudId.description: The ID of a cloud provider.

description.description: The description of the cloud provider.

get.description:
Lists all clusters in the specified cloud region. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request GET "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/clusters?pageSize=10¤t=1" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "count": 1, "currentPage": 1, "pageSize": 10, "clusters": [ { "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "clusterName": "Cluster-01", "description": "", "regionId": "gcp-us-west1", "clusterType": "Cost-optimized", "plan": "Free", "cuSize": 0, "status": "RUNNING", "connectAddress": "https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com", "privateLinkAddress": "", "projectId": "proj-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "createTime": "2024-04-01T06:42:31Z" } ] } } ```

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of records to return on each page.

parameters.name: current
parameters.description: The current page number.

200.description: Returns a list of your clusters.

count.description: The total number of clusters returned.

currentPage.description: The current page in the results.

pageSize.description: The number of clusters per page in the results.

clusterId.description: The ID of the cluster.

description.description: An optional description about the cluster.

regionId.description: The ID of the region where the cluster exists.

clusterType.description: The type of CU associated with the cluster. Possible values are **Performance-optimized** and **Capacity-optimized**.

cuSize.description: The size of the CU associated with the cluster.

status.description: The current status of the cluster. Possible values are **INITIALIZING**, **RUNNING**, **SUSPENDING**, and **RESUMING**.

connectAddress.description: The public endpoint of the cluster. You can connect to the cluster using this endpoint from the public network.

privateLinkAddress.description: The private endpoint of the cluster. You can set up a private link to allow your VPS in the same cloud region to access your cluster.

createTime.description: The time at which the cluster has been created.

clusters.description: An array of clusters in detail.

post.description:
Imports data from files stored in a specified object storage bucket. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" export ACCESS_KEY="" export SECRET_KEY="" curl --location --request POST "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/vector/collections/import" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --data-raw '{ "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "collectionName": "medium_articles", "objectUrl": "gs://docs-demo/1af78216-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-2b0a73c566ed/1.parquet", "accessKey": "${ACCESS_KEY}", "secretKey": "${SECRET_KEY}" }' ``` Possible return is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "jobId": "job-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" } } ```

clusterId.description: The ID of a cluster to which this operation applies.

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to which this operation applies.

partitionName.description: The name of the partition to which this operation applies.

objectUrl.description: The URL of the object that stores the data to be imported.

accessKey.description: The access key used to access the specified object.

secretKey.description: The access secret key used to access the specified object.

200.description: Returns a import task job ID.

jobId.description: The ID of the import task that has been submitted

post.description:
Imports data from files stored in a specified object storage bucket. To learn how to prepare your data files, read [Prepare Data Import](/docs/prepare-source-data). ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export API_KEY="" curl --location --request POST "https://api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn/v2/vectordb/jobs/import/create" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" \ --data-raw '{ "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "collectionName": "medium_articles", "partitionName":"", "objectUrl": "https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/publicdataset.zillizcloud.com/medium_articles_2020_dpr/medium_articles_2020_dpr.json", "accessKey": "", "secretKey": "" }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following ```json { "code": 0, "data": { "jobId": "448707763884413158" } } ```

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization token. You should always use an API key with appropriate permissions.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Use `application/json`.

clusterId.description: ID of a cluster to which this operation applies.

collectionName.description: Name of the target collection.Setting this to a non-existing collection results in an error.

partitionName.description: Name of the partition to which this operation applies.

objectUrl.description: URL of the object that stores the data to be imported.

accessKey.description: Access key used to access the specified object.

secretKey.description: Access secret key used to access the specified object.

200.description: Returns the ID of the created import jobs.

jobId.description: ID of the import job that has been submitted.

get.description:
Describe a specific pipeline by its name. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request GET "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/pipelines/pipe-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" ``` Possible return is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "pipelineId": "pipe-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "name": "my_doc_ingestion_pipeline", "type": "INGESTION", "createTimestamp": 1720601290000, "description": "A doc ingestion pipeline", "status": "SERVING", "totalUsage": { "embedding": 0 }, "functions": [ { "name": "index_my_doc", "action": "INDEX_DOC", "inputFields": [ "doc_url", "doc_name" ], "language": "ENGLISH", "chunkSize": 500, "splitBy": [ "\n\n", "\n", " ", "" ], "embedding": "zilliz/bge-base-en-v1.5" }, { "name": "keep_doc_info", "action": "PRESERVE", "inputField": "publish_year", "outputField": "publish_year", "fieldType": "Int16" } ], "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "collectionName": "doc_pipeline" } } ```

parameters.name: PIPELINE_ID
parameters.description: A valid pipeline ID obtained from either the list-pipelines API endpoints or Zilliz Cloud console.

200.description: Returns a pipeline in detail.

name.description: Name of the pipeline.

type.description: Type of the pipeline. For an ingestion pipeline, the value should be `INGESTION`.

status.description: Current status of the pipeline. If the value is other than `SERVING`, the pipeline is not working.

name.description: Name of the function to create.

action.description: Type of the function to create. For an ingestion pipeline,  possible values are `INDEX_DOC` and `PRESERVE`.

inputField.description: Name the field according to your needs. In an `INDEX_DOC` function of an ingestion pipeline, use it for pre-signed document URLs in GCS or AWS S3 buckets.

langauge.description: Language that your document is in. Possible values are `english` or `chinese`. The parameter applies only to ingestion pipelines.

chunkSize.description: The maximum size of a splitted document segment.

embedding.description: Name of the embedding model in use.

splitBy.description: The splitters that Zilliz Cloud uses to split the specified docs.

name.description: Name of the function to create.

action.description: Type of the function to create. For an ingestion pipeline,  possible values are `INDEX_DOC` and `PRESERVE`.

inputField.description: Name the field according to your needs. In a preserve function of an ingestion pipeline, Zilliz Cloud uses the value as the name of a field in the collection to create.

outputField.description: Name of the output field. The value should be the same as that of `input_field`.

fieldType.description: Data type of the field to create in the target collection. Possible values are `BOOL`, `INT8`, `INT16`, `INT32`, `INT64`, `FLOAT`, `DOUBLE`, and `VARCHAR`.

functions.description: Functions in the pipeline. For an ingestion pipeline, there should be only one `INDEX_DOC` function.

clusterID.description: The target cluster to which the pipeline applies.

collectionName.description: The target collection to which the pipeline applies.

name.description: Name of the pipeline

type.description: Type of the pipeline. For a search pipeline, the value should be `SEARCH`.

status.description: Current status of the pipeline. If the value is not `SERVING`, the pipeline is not working.

name.description: Name of the function.

action.description: Type of the function. For a search function, the value should be `SEARCH_DOC_CHUNKS`.

inputField.description: Name of the input field. For a `SEARCH_DOC_CHUNKS` function, the value should be your query text.

collectionName.description: Target collection of this function.

functions.description: Functions in the pipeline. For a search pipeline, each of its member functions targets at a different collection.

clusterId.description: Target cluster of the pipeline.

collectionName.description: Target collection of the pipeline.

name.description: Name of the pipeline.

type.description: Type of the pipeline. For a deletion pipeline, the value should be `DELETION`.

status.description: Current status of the pipeline. If the value is not `SERVING`, the pipeline is not working.

name.description: Name of the function.

action.description: Type of the function. For a deletion pipeline, its member functions should be of `PURGE_DOC_INDEX`.

inputField.description: Name of the input field. For a `PURGE_DOC_INDEX` function, the value should be the name of the doc to delete.

functions.description: Functions in the pipeline. For a deletion pipeline, there can be multiple member functions with each representing a deletion request.

collectionName.description: Target collection of the pipeline.

delete.description:
Drop a specific pipeline ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request DELETE "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/pipelines/pipe-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "pipelineId": "pipe-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "name": "my_doc_ingestion_pipeline", "type": "INGESTION", "createTimestamp": 1720601290000, "description": "A doc ingestion pipeline", "status": "SERVING", "totalUsage": { "embedding": 0 }, "functions": [ { "name": "index_my_doc", "action": "INDEX_DOC", "inputFields": [ "doc_url", "doc_name" ], "language": "ENGLISH", "chunkSize": 500, "splitBy": [ "\n\n", "\n", " ", "" ], "embedding": "zilliz/bge-base-en-v1.5" }, { "name": "keep_doc_info", "action": "PRESERVE", "inputField": "publish_year", "outputField": "publish_year", "fieldType": "Int16" } ], "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "collectionName": "doc_pipeline" } } ```

200.description: Returns information of a specific pipeline just dropped.

name.description: Name of the pipeline.

type.description: Type of the pipeline. For an ingestion pipeline, the value should be `INGESTION`.

status.description: Current status of the pipeline. If the value is other than `SERVING`, the pipeline is not working.

name.description: Name of the function to create.

action.description: Type of the function to create. For an ingestion pipeline,  possible values are `INDEX_DOC` and `PRESERVE`.

inputFields.description: Names the fields according to your needs. In an `INDEX_TEXT` function of an ingestion pipeline, use them for the user-provided texts.

langauge.description: Language that your document is in. Possible values are `english` or `chinese`. The parameter applies only to ingestion pipelines.

embedding.description: Name of the embedding model in use.

name.description: Name of the function to create.

action.description: Type of the function to create. For an ingestion pipeline,  possible values are `INDEX_DOC` and `PRESERVE`.

inputField.description: Name the field according to your needs. In an `INDEX_DOC` function of an ingestion pipeline, use it for pre-signed document URLs in GCS or AWS S3 buckets.

langauge.description: Language that your document is in. Possible values are `english` or `chinese`. The parameter applies only to ingestion pipelines.

chunkSize.description: The maximum size of a splitted document segment.

embedding.description: Name of the embedding model in use.

splitBy.description: The splitters that Zilliz Cloud uses to split the specified docs.

name.description: Name of the function to create.

action.description: Type of the function to create. For an ingestion pipeline,  possible values are `INDEX_DOC` and `PRESERVE`.

inputFields.description: Names the fields according to your needs. In an `INDEX_IMAGE` function of an ingestion pipeline: `image_url` stands for pre-signed image URLs in GCS or AWS S3 buckets, and `image_id` stands for the image ID.

embedding.description: Name of the embedding model in use.

name.description: Name of the function to create.

action.description: Type of the function to create. For an ingestion pipeline,  possible values are `INDEX_DOC` and `PRESERVE`.

inputField.description: Name the field according to your needs. In a preserve function of an ingestion pipeline, Zilliz Cloud uses the value as the name of a field in the collection to create.

outputField.description: Name of the output field. The value should be the same as that of `input_field`.

fieldType.description: Data type of the field to create in the target collection. Possible values are `BOOL`, `INT8`, `INT16`, `INT32`, `INT64`, `FLOAT`, `DOUBLE`, and `VARCHAR`.

functions.description: Functions in the pipeline. For an ingestion pipeline, there should be only one `INDEX_DOC` function.

clusterID.description: The target cluster to which the pipeline applies.

collectionName.description: The target collection to which the pipeline applies.

name.description: Name of the pipeline

type.description: Type of the pipeline. For a search pipeline, the value should be `SEARCH`.

status.description: Current status of the pipeline. If the value is not `SERVING`, the pipeline is not working.

name.description: Name of the function.

action.description: Type of the function. For a search function, the value should be `SEARCH_DOC_CHUNKS`, `SEARCH_TEXT`, `SEARCH_IMAGE_BY_IMAGE`, and `SEARCH_IMAGE_BY_TEXT`.

items.description: For a `SEARCH_DOC_CHUNKS` or a `SEARCH_IMAGE_BY_TEXT` function, you should include `query_text` as the value.

collectionName.description: Target collection of this function.

reranker.description: If you need to reorder or rank a set of candidate outputs to improve the quality of the search results, set this parameter to a reranker model. This parameter applies only to pipelines for Text and Doc Data. Currently, only `zilliz/bge-reranker-base` is available as the parameter value.

functions.description: Functions in the pipeline. For a search pipeline, each of its member functions targets at a different collection.

name.description: Name of the pipeline.

type.description: Type of the pipeline. For a deletion pipeline, the value should be `DELETION`.

status.description: Current status of the pipeline. If the value is not `SERVING`, the pipeline is not working.

name.description: Name of the function.

action.description: Type of the function. For a deletion pipeline, its member functions should be of `PURGE_BY_EXPRESSION`, `PURGE_DOC_INDEX`, and `PURGE_IMAGE_BY_ID`.

inputField.description: Name of the input field. For a `PURGE_DOC_INDEX` function, the value should be the name of the doc to delete.

functions.description: Functions in the pipeline. For a deletion pipeline, there can be multiple member functions with each representing a deletion request.

collectionName.description: Target collection of the pipeline.

get.description:
Lists collections in a cluster. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; You can use either of the following ways to authorize:
  • An API Key with appropriate permissions.
  • A colon-joined username and password of the target cluster. For example, `username:passowrd`.
 ```shell export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com" export TOKEN="username:password" curl --location --request POST "http://${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v1/vector/collections" \ export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com:19530" export TOKEN="db_admin:xxxxxxxxxxx" curl --location --request POST "http://${CLOUD_ENDPOINT}/v1/vector/collections" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${TOKEN}" \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": [ "custom_setup_not_indexed", "quick_setup", "custom_setup_indexed" ] } ```

parameters.name: dbName
parameters.description: The name of the database

200.description: Returns a list of collections in the specified cluster.

post.description:
Deletes one or more entities from a collection. import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; You can use either of the following ways to authorize:
  • An API Key with appropriate permissions.
  • A colon-joined username and password of the target cluster. For example, `username:passowrd`.
 ```shell export MILVUS_URI="http://localhost:19530" export TOKEN="username:password" curl --request POST \ --url "${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v1/vector/delete" \ export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com:19530" export TOKEN="db_admin:xxxxxxxxxxx" curl --request POST \ --url "${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v1/vector/delete" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${TOKEN}" \ --header "accept: application/json" \ --header "content-type: application/json" \ -d '{ "collectionName": "medium_articles", "id": 1 }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": {} } ```

dbName.description: The name of the database.

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to which this operation applies.

id.description: The ID of the entity to be retrieved

dbName.description: The name of the database.

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to which this operation applies.

id.description: An array of IDs of the entities to be retrieved

dbName.description: The name of the database.

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to which this operation applies.

id.description: The ID of the entity to be retrieved

dbName.description: The name of the database.

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to which this operation applies.

id.description: An array of IDs of the entities to be retrieved

200.description: Returns an empty object.

post.description:
This operation deletes entities by their IDs or with a boolean expression. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; You can use either of the following ways to authorize:
  • An API Key with appropriate permissions.
  • A colon-joined username and password of the target cluster. For example, `username:passowrd`.
 ```shell export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com" export TOKEN="username:password" curl --location --request POST "http://${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v2/vectordb/entities/delete" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${TOKEN}" \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" \ --data-raw '{ "collectionName": "quick_setup", "filter": "id in [0,1]" }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 0, "data": {} } ```

parameters.name: Request-Timeout
parameters.description:
The timeout duration for this operation.
Setting this to None indicates that this operation timeouts when any response arrives or any error occurs.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authentication token.

dbName.description: The name of the target database.

collectionName.description: The name of an existing collection.

filter.description:
A scalar filtering condition to filter matching entities.    The value defaults to an empty string, indicating that no condition applies. Setting both **id** and **filter** results in an error.
You can set this parameter to an empty string to skip scalar filtering. To build a scalar filtering condition, refer to [Boolean Expression Rules](https://milvus.io/docs/boolean.md).

partitionName.description:
The name of a partition in the current collection. 
If specified, the data is to be deleted from the specified partition.

200.description: A dictionary contains the number of deleted entities.

post.description:
This operation lists all collections in the specified database. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; You can use either of the following ways to authorize:
  • An API Key with appropriate permissions.
  • A colon-joined username and password of the target cluster. For example, `username:passowrd`.
 ```shell export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com" export TOKEN="username:password" curl --location --request POST "http://${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v2/vectordb/collections/list" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${TOKEN}" \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" ``` The possible output will be similar to the following: ```json { "code": 0, "data": [ "quick_setup_new", "customized_setup_1", "customized_setup_2" ] } ```

parameters.name: Request-Timeout
parameters.description: The timeout duration for this operation. Setting this to None indicates that this operation times out when any response returns or an error occurs.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authentication token

dbName.description: The name of an existing database.

200.description: This operation lists all collections in the database used in the current connection.

get.description:
Lists all available cloud regions of a specific cloud provider. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request GET "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/regions?cloudId=gcp" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": [ { "cloudId": "gcp", "domain": "*.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com", "regionId": "gcp-us-west1" } ] } ```

parameters.name: cloudId
parameters.description: The ID of a valid cloud provider.

200.description: Returns a list of all available regions that the specified cloud provider offers.

cloudId.description: The ID of a cloud provider

regionId.description: The ID of a cloud region

domain.description: The base URL of an Zilliz Cloud open API endpiont

get.description:
Retrieves the progress of a specified import task. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export JOB_ID="job-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" export CLUSTER_ID="inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request GET "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/vector/collections/import/get?jobId=${JOB_ID}&clusterId=${CLUSTER_ID}" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" ``` Possible return is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "collectionName": "medium_articles", "fileName": "1af78216-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-2b0a73c566ed/1.parquet", "fileSize": 19599887, "readyPercentage": 0, "completeTime": null, "errorMessage": null, "jobId": "job-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "details": [ { "fileName": "1af78216-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-2b0a73c566ed/1.parquet", "fileSize": 19599887, "readyPercentage": 0, "completeTime": null, "errorMessage": null } ] } } ```

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The ID of the import task in concern

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The ID of a cluster to which this operation applies.

200.description: Returns the progress of the specified job ID in percentage.

fileName.description: The path of the data file object in the object storage.

fileSize.description: The size of the data file object.

readyPercentage.description: The indicator of the import progress

completeTime.description: The time at which the import task completes. `null` indicates that the file import is going on.

errorMessage.description: The message that explains the reason for an import failure. `null` indicates that no error occurs.

collectionName.description: The target collection name of the import task.

jobId.description: The ID of an import task.

fileName.description: The path to a file being imported.

fileSize.description: The size of a file being imported.

readyPercentage.description: The import progress of a specific file.

completeTime.description: The time at which the import progress ends for a specific file. `null` indicates that the file import is going on.

errorMessage.description: The message that explains the reason for an import failure. `null` indicates that no error occurs.

post.description:
This creates an pipeline. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs'; import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 Currently, you can create pipelines to ingest data into and search/purge data from your collections. The request parameters vary with the type of pipelines you want to create and the data you want to process. ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --request POST \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --url "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/pipelines" \ -d '{ "name": "my_text_ingestion_pipeline", "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "projectId": "proj-xxxx"ï¼Œ "collectionName": "my_collection", "description": "A pipeline that generates text embeddings and stores additional fields.", "type": "INGESTION", "functions": [ { "name": "index_my_text", "action": "INDEX_TEXT", "language": "ENGLISH", "embedding": "zilliz/bge-base-en-v1.5" }, { "name": "keep_text_info", "action": "PRESERVE", "inputField": "source", "outputField": "source", "fieldType": "VarChar" } ] }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "pipelineId": "pipe-xxxx", "name": "my_text_ingestion_pipeline", "type": "INGESTION", "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "collectionName": "my_collection" "description": "A pipeline that generates text embeddings and stores additional fields.", "status": "SERVING", "functions": [ { "action": "INDEX_TEXT", "name": "index_my_text", "inputFields": ["text_list"], "language": "ENGLISH", "embedding": "zilliz/bge-base-en-v1.5" }, { "action": "PRESERVE", "name": "keep_text_info", "inputField": "source", "outputField": "source", "fieldType": "VarChar" } ] } } ``` ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --request POST \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --url "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/pipelines" \ -d '{ "projectId": "proj-xxxx"ï¼Œ "name": "my_doc_ingestion_pipeline", "description": "A pipeline that splits a doc file into chunks and generates embeddings. It also stores the publish_year with each chunk.", "type": "INGESTION", "functions": [ { "name": "index_my_doc", "action": "INDEX_DOC", "language": "ENGLISH", "chunkSize": 500, "embedding": "zilliz/bge-base-en-v1.5", "splitBy": ["\n\n", "\n", " ", ""] }, { "name": "keep_doc_info", "action": "PRESERVE", "inputField": "publish_year", "outputField": "publish_year", "fieldType": "Int16" } ], "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "newCollectionName": "my_collection" }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following: ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "pipelineId": "pipe-xxxx", "name": "my_doc_ingestion_pipeline", "type": "INGESTION", "description": "A pipeline that splits a doc file into chunks and generates embeddings. get.description:
List all pipelines in a project. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request GET "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/pipelines?projectId=proj-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" ``` Possible return is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": [ { "pipelineId": "pipe-cf7c8f130608912949a032", "name": "my_doc_ingestion_pipeline", "type": "INGESTION", "createTimestamp": 1720601290000, "description": "A doc ingestion pipeline", "status": "SERVING", "totalUsage": { "embedding": 0 }, "functions": [ { "name": "index_my_doc", "action": "INDEX_DOC", "inputFields": [ "doc_url", "doc_name" ], "language": "ENGLISH", "chunkSize": 500, "splitBy": [ "\n\n", "\n", " ", "" ], "embedding": "zilliz/bge-base-en-v1.5" }, { "name": "keep_doc_info", "action": "PRESERVE", "inputField": "publish_year", "outputField": "publish_year", "fieldType": "Int16" } ], "clusterId": "in03-bdfdb12c2f6cae2", "collectionName": "doc_pipeline" }, { "pipelineId": "pipe-22bf025b1941499b56e73f", "name": "my_text_ingestion_pipeline", "type": "INGESTION", "createTimestamp": 1720601012000, "description": "A text ingestion pipeline", "status": "SERVING", "totalUsage": { "embedding": 0 }, "functions": [ { "name": "index_my_text", "action": "INDEX_TEXT", "inputFields": [ "text_list" ], "language": "ENGLISH", "embedding": "zilliz/bge-base-en-v1.5" }, { "name": "keep_text_info", "action": "PRESERVE", "inputField": "source", "outputField": "source", "fieldType": "VarChar" } ], "clusterId": "in03-bdfdb12c2f6cae2", "collectionName": "text_pipeline" } ] } ```

post.description:
Creates a collection in a cluster. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; You can use either of the following ways to authorize:
  • An API Key with appropriate permissions.
  • A colon-joined username and password of the target cluster. For example, `username:passowrd`.
 ```shell export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com" export TOKEN="username:password" curl --request POST \ --url "${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v1/vector/collections/create" \ export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com:19530" export TOKEN="db_admin:xxxxxxxxxxx" curl --request POST \ --url "${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v1/vector/collections/create" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${TOKEN}" \ --header "accept: application/json" \ --header "content-type: application/json" \ -d '{ "collectionName": "medium_articles", "dimension": 256, "metricType": "L2", "primaryField": "id", "vectorField": "vector" }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": {} } ```

dbName.description: The name of the database. <include target="zilliz">This parameter applies only to dedicated clusters.</include>

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to create.

dimension.description: The number of dimensions for the vector field of the collection. For performance-optimized CUs, this value ranges from 1 to 32768. For capacity-optimized and cost-optimized CUs, this value ranges from 32 to 32768.

metricType.description: The distance metric used for the collection.

200.description: Returns an empty object.

post.description: Inserts one or more entities into a collection. You can add a maximum of 100 entities at a time. To insert large volumn of data, you are advised to use [the bulk-insert API](https://docs.zilliz.com/docs/data-import).

dbName.description: The name of the database.

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to which entities will be inserted.

data.description: An entity object. Note that the keys in the entity should match the collection schema.

dbName.description: The name of the database.

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to which entities will be inserted.

partitionName.description: The name of the partition to which this operation applies.

data.description: An array of entity objects. Note that the keys in an entity object should match the collection schema

200.description: Returns the number of inserted entities and an array of their IDs.

insertIds.description: An array of the IDs of inserted entities.

post.description:
This creates a named index for a target field, which can either be a vector field or a scalar field. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; You can use either of the following ways to authorize:
  • An API Key with appropriate permissions.
  • A colon-joined username and password of the target cluster. For example, `username:passowrd`.
 ```shell export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com" export TOKEN="username:password" curl --location --request POST "http://${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v2/vectordb/indexes/create" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${TOKEN}" \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" \ --data-raw '{ "collectionName": "custom_setup_not_indexed", "indexParams": [ { "metricType": "L2", "fieldName": "my_vector", "indexName": "my_vector", "indexConfig": { "index_type": "AUTOINDEX", } } ] }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following: ```json { "code": 0, "data": {} } ```

parameters.name: Request-Timeout
parameters.description:
The timeout duration for this operation.
Setting this to None indicates that this operation timeouts when any response arrives or any error occurs.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authentication token.

dbName.description:
The name of the database to which the collection belongs.
Setting this to a non-existing database results in an error.

collectionName.description:
The name of the target collection.
Setting this to a non-existing collection results in an error.

metricType.description: The similarity metric type used to build the index.

fieldName.description: The name of the target field on which an index is to be created.

indexName.description: The name of the index to create, the value defaults to the target field name.

params.description: The index type and related settings. For details, refer to [Vector Indexes](https://milvus.io/docs/index.md).

index_type.description: The type of the index to create

M.description: The maximum degree of the node and applies only when index_type is set to __HNSW__.

efConstruction.description: The search scope. This applies only when **index_type** is set to **HNSW**

nlist.description: The number of cluster units. This applies to IVF-related index types.

indexParams.description: The parameters that apply to the index-building process.

200.description: A Status object indicating whether this operation succeeds.

get.description:
List all import jobs specific to a cluster. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export CLUSTER_ID="inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request GET "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/vector/collections/import/list?clusterId=${CLUSTER_ID}&pageSize=10¤tPage=1" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" ``` Possible return is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "tasks": [ { "collectionName": "medium_articles", "jobId": "job-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "state": "ImportRunning" }, { "collectionName": "medium_articles", "jobId": "2b93fef7-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-f82afd598ff1", "state": "ImportCompleted" } ], "count": 2, "currentPage": 1, "pageSize": 10 } } ```

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of records to return at each request.

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: The current page number.

200.description: Returns a list of import jobs.

count.description: Total number of records listed in this response.

currentPage.description: The current page number for your reference.

pageSize.description: The maximum number of records to be included in each return.

collectionName.description: The target collection name of a import task.

jobId.description: The ID of an import task.

state.description: The corresponding status of the import task. Possible values are ImportRunning, ImportCompleted and ImportFailed.

parameters.name: PIPELINE_ID
parameters.description: A valid pipeline ID obtained from either the list-pipelines API endpoints or Zilliz Cloud console.

doc_url.description: The URL of the document stored on an object storage. You should use a URL that is either not encoded or encoded in UTF-8. Ensure that the URL remains valid for at least one hour.

\\{YOUR_PRESERVED_FIELD}.description: The metadata field to preserve. The input field name should be consistent with what you defined when creating the Ingestion pipeline and adding the PRESERVE function. The value of this field should also follow the predefined field type.

text_list.description: The text or text list to ingest.

source.description: The metadata field to preserve. The input field name should be consistent with what you defined when creating the Ingestion pipeline and adding the PRESERVE function. The value of this field should also follow the predefined field type.

image_url.description: The URL of the image stored on an object storage. You should use a URL that is either not encoded or encoded in UTF-8. Ensure that the URL remains valid for at least one hour.

image_id.description: The ID of the image stored on an object storage.

query_text.description: A query text. Zilliz Cloud embeds it and use the generated vector embeddings to conduct a search in the target collection. This applies to pipelines of a SEARCH_TEXT, a SEARCH_DOC_CHUNK, or a SEARCH_IMAGE_BY_TEXT type.

query_image_url.description: The URL of a query image. This applies to pipelines of a SEARCH_IMAGE_BY_IMAGE type.

limit.description: Total number of records to return.

offset.description: Total number of records to skip in the search results.

items.description: A valid output field and should be the one defined in the preserve functions.

outputFields.description: A list of fields to output for each match in the search result.

filter.description: A boolean expression for Zilliz Cloud to filter records before actual searches.

expression.description: A filter expression. This applies to pipelines of the INDEX_TEXT type.

doc_name.description: Name of the document to delete. Note that you can delete document by its name, and all the chunks of the document will be removed. This applies to pipelines of the INDEX_DOC_CHUNK type.

image_id.description: ID of an image. This applies to pipelines of the INDEX_IMAGE type.

data.description: Payload of the doc deletion request.

200.description: Returns the result of running a specific pipeline.

num_entities.description: Number of text strings added to the collection.

ids.description: IDs of the returned text strings in the collection.

embedding.description: Number of tokens used in text embedding

doc_name.description: Name of the chunked document with the file extension.

Number of tokens used in image embedding

id.description: ID of a hit entity, representing a chunk of a document.

distance.description: Distance to the vector embedings of the specified query string.

anyOf.description: Returned search result. It is an array of objects.

This operation lists all partitions in the database used in the current connection. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition'; You can use either of the following ways to authorize:
  • An API Key with appropriate permissions.
  • A colon-joined username and password of the target cluster. For example, `username:passowrd`.
 ```shell export CLUSTER_ENDPOINT="https://inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.api.gcp-us-west1.zillizcloud.com" export TOKEN="username:password" curl --location --request POST "http://${CLUSTER_ENDPOINT}/v2/vectordb/partitions/list" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${TOKEN}" \ --header "Content-Type: application/json" \ --data-raw '{ "collectionName": "quick_setup" }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following: ```json { "code": 0, "data": [ "_default" ] } ```

parameters.name: Request-Timeout
parameters.description:
The timeout duration for this operation.
Setting this to None indicates that this operation timeouts when any response arrives or any error occurs.

dbName.description: The name of the target database.

collectionName.description: The name of the target collection to which the partition belongs.

200.description: A list of partition names.

start.description: The starting date and time for the metric reporting period, expressed in ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC. Include this parameter when the `period` parameter is not set.

end.description: The ending date and time for the metric reporting period, expressed in ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC. Include this parameter when the `period` parameter is not set.

period.description: The duration over which Milvus reports the metrics, expressed in ISO 8601 duration format in UTC. Include this parameter when both `start` and `end` parameters are not set.

granularity.description: The time interval at which Milvus reports the metrics, expressed in ISO 8601 duration format in UTC. The minimum granularity is PT30S.

name.description: The name of the metric to query. Valid values include **CU_COMPUTATION**, **CU_CAPACITY**, **STORAGE_USE**, **REQ_INSERT_COUNT**, **REQ_BULK_INSERT_COUNT**, **REQ_UPSERT_COUNT**, **REQ_DELETE_COUNT**, **REQ_SEARCH_COUNT**, **REQ_QUERY_COUNT**, **VECTOR_REQ_INSERT_COUNT**, **VECTOR_REQ_UPSERT_COUNT**, **VECTOR_REQ_SEARCH_COUNT**, **REQ_INSERT_LATENCY**, **REQ_BULK_INSERT_LATENCY**, **REQ_UPSERT_LATENCY**, **REQ_DELETE_LATENCY**, **REQ_SEARCH_LATENCY**, **REQ_QUERY_LATENCY**, **REQ_SUCCESS_RATE**, **REQ_FAIL_RATE**, **REQ_FAIL_RATE_INSERT**, **REQ_FAIL_RATE_BULK_INSERT**, **REQ_FAIL_RATE_UPSERT**, **REQ_FAIL_RATE_DELETE**, **REQ_FAIL_RATE_SEARCH**, **REQ_FAIL_RATE_QUERY**, **ENTITIES_LOADED**, **ENTITIES_INSERT_RATE**, **COLLECTIONS_COUNT**, **ENTITIES_COUNT**.

stat.description: The statistical method to apply to the metric. Valid values include **AVG** (average) and **P99** (99th percentile) for latency metrics. **AVG** is available for all other metrics.

200.description: Returns the collected statistics on the queried metrics.

name.description: The name of the metric.

stat.description: The statistical function applied to the metric.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the metric (e.g., percent).

timestamp.description: The timestamp for the data point in ISO 8601 format.

value.description: The value of the metric at the given timestamp.

data.description: The container for the response data.

parameters.description: The authorization token. You should always use an API key with appropriate permissions.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of records to include in each response.

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: The current page number.

200.description: Return a list of clusters in detail.

clusterId.description: ID of a cluster.

regionId.description: ID of the cloud region hosting the cluster.

cuType.description:
CU type of the cluster.

parameters.name: Request-Timeout
parameters.description:
The timeout duration for this operation.
Setting this to None indicates that this operation timeouts when any response arrives or any error occurs.

The password must be a string of 8 to 64 characters and must include at least three of the following character types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters.

get.description:
List all projects scoped to API-Key. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export API_KEY="" curl --request GET \ --url "https://api.cloud.zilliz.com.cn/v2/projects" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --header "accept: application/json" ``` Possible response is similar to the following ```json { "code": 200, "data": [ { "projectName": "Default Project", "projectId": "proj-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "instanceCount": 2, "createTime": "2023-08-16T07:34:06Z" } ] } ```

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization token. You should always use an API key with appropriate permissions.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Use `application/json`.

200.description: Return a list of projects in detail.

instanceCount.description: Number of clusters in the projects.

createTime.description: Time at which the project is created.

parameters.name: Request-Timeout
parameters.description: The timeout duration for this operation. Setting this to None indicates that this operation times out when any response returns or an error occurs.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authentication token.

dbName.description: The name of the database. <include target="zilliz">This parameter applies only to dedicated clusters.</include>

collectionName.description: The name of the collection to create.

dimension.description:
The number of dimensions a vector value should have.
This is required if **dtype** of this field is set to **DataType.FLOAT_VECTOR**.

metricType.description:
The metric type applied to this operation. 
Possible values are **L2**, **IP**, and **COSINE**.

idType.description: The data type of the primary field. This parameter is designed for the quick-setup of a collection and will be ignored if __schema__ is defined.

autoID.description: Whether the primary field automatically increments. This parameter is designed for the quick-setup of a collection and will be ignored if __schema__ is defined.

primaryFieldName.description: The name of the primary field. This parameter is designed for the quick-setup of a collection and will be ignored if __schema__ is defined.

vectorFieldName.description: The name of the vector field. This parameter is designed for the quick-setup of a collection and will be ignored if __schema__ is defined.

schema.description: The schema is responsible for organizing data in the target collection. A valid schema should have multiple fields, which must include a primary key, a vector field, and several scalar fields.

autoID.description: Whether allows the primary field to automatically increment. Setting this to True makes the primary field automatically increment. In this case, the primary field should not be included in the data to insert to avoid errors. Set this parameter in the field with is_primary set to True.

enableDynamicField.description: Whether allows to use the reserved __$meta__ field to hold non-schema-defined fields in key-value pairs.

fieldName.description: The name of the field to create in the target collection

dataType.description: The data type of the field values. Possible values are: **DataType.BOOL**, **DataType.INT8**, **DataType.INT16**, **DataType.INT32**, **DataType.INT64**, **DataType.FLOAT**, **DataType.DOUBLE**, **DataType.VARCHAR**, **DataType.ARRAY**, **DataType.JSON**, **DataType.BINARY_VECTOR**, **DataType.FLOAT_VECTOR**, **DataType.FLOAT16_VECTOR**, **DataType.BFLOAT16_VECTOR**, **DataType.SPARSE_FLOAT_VECTOR**.

elementDataType.description: The data type of the elements in an array field. Possible values are: **DataType.BOOL**, **DataType.INT8**, **DataType.INT16**, **DataType.INT32**, **DataType.INT64**, **DataType.FLOAT**, **DataType.DOUBLE**, **DataType.VARCHAR**.

isPrimary.description: Whether the current field is the primary field. Setting this to True makes the current field the primary field.

isPartitionKey.description: Whether the current field serves as the partition key. Setting this to True makes the current field serve as the partition key. In this case, MilvusZilliz Cloud manages all partitions in the current collection.

max_length.description: An optional parameter for VarChar values that determines the maximum length of the value in the current field.

dim.description: An optional parameter for FloatVector or BinaryVector fields that determines the vector dimension.

max_capacity.description: An optional parameter for Array field values that determines the maximum number of elements in the current array field.

metricType.description: The similarity metric type used to build the index.

fieldName.description: The name of the target field on which an index is to be created.

indexName.description: The name of the index to create, the value defaults to the target field name.

params.description: The index type and related settings. For details, refer to [Vector Indexes](https://milvus.io/docs/index.md).

index_type.description: The type of the index to create

M.description: The maximum degree of the node and applies only when index_type is set to __HNSW__.

efConstruction.description: The search scope. This applies only when **index_type** is set to **HNSW**

nlist.description: The number of cluster units. This applies to IVF-related index types.

indexParams.description: The parameters that apply to the index-building process.

max_length.description: The maximum number of characters in a VarChar field. This parameter is mandatory when the current field type is VarChar.

enableDynamicField.description: Whether to enable the reserved dynamic field. If set to true, non-schema-defined fields are saved in the reserved dynamic field as key-value pairs.

shardsNum.description: The number of shards to create along with the current collection.

consistencyLevel.description: The consistency level of the collection. Possible values are __STRONG__, __BOUNDED__, __SESSION__, and __EVENTUALLY__.

partitionsNum.description: The number of partitions to create along with the current collection. This parameter is mandatory if one field of the collection has been designated as the partition key.

ttlSeconds.description: The time-to-live (TTL) period of the collection. If set, the collection is to be dropped once the period ends.

200.description: Returns A collection object.

post.description:
Creates a new cluster. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

 ```shell export CLOUD_REGION="gcp-us-west1" export API_KEY="" curl --location --request POST "https://controller.api.${CLOUD_REGION}.zillizcloud.com/v1/clusters/create" \ --header "Authorization: Bearer ${API_KEY}" \ --data-raw '{ "cuSize": 1, "clusterName": "Cluster-02", "projectId": "proj-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "plan": "Standard", "cuType": "Performance-optimized" }' ``` Possible response is similar to the following. ```json { "code": 200, "data": { "clusterId": "inxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "username": "db_admin", "password": "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx", "prompt": "Submission successful, Cluster is being created, You can use the DescribeCluster interface to obtain the creation progress and the status of the Cluster. When the Cluster status is RUNNING, you can access your vector database using the SDK with the admin account and the initialization password you provided." } } ```

plan.description: The plan tier of the Zilliz Cloud service.

clusterName.description: The name of the cluster to be created. It is a string of no more than 32 characters.

cuSize.description: The size of the CU to be used for the created cluster. It is an integer from 1 to 256.

cuType.description: The type of the CU used for the Zilliz Cloud cluster to be created.

projectId.description: The ID of the project where the cluster is to be created.

200.description: Returns an object that contains the details of the created cluster.

Drop Cluster. ## Example import Admonition from '@theme/Admonition';

This API requires an API key as the authentication token.

If you consider this action to be an error, you have the option to restore the deleted cluster from the recycle bin within a 30-day period. Kindly note, this recovery feature does not apply to free clusters." } } ```

granularity.description: The time interval at which Milvus reports the metrics, expressed in ISO 8601 duration format in UTC. The minimum granularity is PT30S.
